FuncDef: The reset statistics interface command deletes traffic statistics of an interface bound to a VSI.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a VSI name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Specifies an interface type.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.

Specifies an interface type.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.

Specifies an interface number.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset statistics interface GigabitEthernet1/0/2.1 vsi vsi1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In a VPLS scenario, if you want to re-collect traffic statistics on a specific interface within a certain period, run the reset statistics interface command to delete the existing statistics on this interface.
Deleted statistics cannot be restored. Therefore, exercise caution when running the reset statistics interface command.
